channel.title: [Public Information] Official Concepts Thread [Truly Unique]
channel.description:
[size=18pt]|Public|[/size] [size=18pt]You may take whatever you like from this Thread![/size] Hello, and welcome to the Official Concepts Thread. What this Thread is about, is basically improving upon and adding features/mechanics/content to RuneScape Private Servers. This is the place to post any ideas or thoughts you might conjure about. I'll go ahead and get the thread moving with these:
Guilds: Guilds are not formed by Players, or even controlled by Players at all. Each Skill has a pre-designated location set aside to be the Guild of the selected Skill. These Guilds require you to pay Dues, complete Tasks, and prove yourself worthy before they will allow you to use their services, or even enter their Guild. Once you enter, you will find that Guilds offer many services and will assist you greatly. You can only be a Member of ONE Guild at a time. If you wish to apply for Membership with another Guild, you will forfeit your current position(Rank)held in your current Guild - even if you don't get accepted by the Guild you applied for. Guilds can be attacked by rival Guilds, such as the Thieiving Guild (a Dark Alignment) being at war with the Prayer Guild (Light Alignment). If a Guild is successfuly Raided by an opposing Guild, the Players who participated in the Raid temporarily gain access to the defeated Guild and all of It's Services/Functions. Guild Ranks: You can perform Tasks, pay your Dues, and Invest into a Guild. Doing this not only helps to advance the Guild, but it will also eventually increase your Rank and Standing with the Guild. This brings great benefits. Here are some current examples of them: 1. Guild N.P.C. will respond differentely (respectfully for example) if you hold a high Rank within the Guild, then the N.P.C. in Dialogue conversations might refer to you as "Sir", "Commander", or even "Guild-Master". 2. Certain Areas of a Guild might be restricted for High-Ranking Guild Members. 3. Certain Guild N.P.C. can be convinced to adventure with you and add small Bonuses according to their Guild Membership. 4. Investing Coins in a Guild might allow you to gain access to other Services which others cannot. For example, by donating a large sum of Coins to a Guild, they might choose to buy a Furnace and Anvil with the Coins you've Invested. Raiding a Guild: This event can only be done once per day, your current Guild must be opposed to another Guild, and you may not use any Prayer during the Guild Raid. Once you speak to the Guild-Master N.P.C. there will be a screen transition, and you will be near the targeted Guild. You must enter the Guild be defeating the Guards defending it. Once all of the Guards outside have been defeated, the Guard Captain will appear - who drops the Key to the Guild Entrance. Once inside, the Player must survive waves of N.P.C. depending upon several factors including: Investments made into the Guild by Players, the current amount of Players who are Members of the Guild, etc. Guild-Standing: Standing is how the N.P.C. of a Guild see you. Current Guild-Standing positions: - Idolized (Highest) - Exalted - Revered - Honored - Friendly - Neutral - Disliked - Enemy - Hated - Loathed
Boots of Lightness: When worn, they increase your Run Energy Regeneration speed by 10%. This effect stacks with Agility statistics and the Agility Skill
Ring of Wealth: When worn, it doesn't effect the chance of getting a rare drop from a N.P.C. Instead, all N.P.C. have a 100% chance of dropping Coins upon their death. This Ring requires 90 Crafting to create.
Beds: All Beds in-game used to serve no purpose. Now, the Player can rest in Beds to restore not only their Hitpoints, but also all of their other Stats and Statistics.
Interactive N.P.C. Text Updates: When a Player gets close to a Boss N.P.C. who is guarding something for example, the N.P.C. will see the Player and have a Yellow Text sentence above their head which will be situation oriented. N.P.C. will also use this feature according to their Special Attacks.
Player Killing: Players will be able to Flag themselves to Enable Player V.S. Player Combat. Once they're Flagged, they are able to attack other Players ONLY IF the other Player is Flagged for P.v.P. as well. The Flag is symbolized by a Red P.K. Skull over their Player-Character. This Skull doesn't affect the amount of Items kept/lost and It's only function is to show that the Player is Flagged for P.v.P. Players who are Flagged can engage in P.v.P. anywhere at anytime, except during key events such as Minigames, Quests, Cinematics, etc.
Archeology: Artifacts can be found and dug up throughout the Land of Cynosure. Equipment that falls under the Artifact Tier requires a level in Archeology to be worn. The dig spots respawn every 8 hours, and there will be many; randomly generated each day. You can learn to identify statues.
Archeology Minigame: The player is qued for the minigame. They are grouped with 4 other people. It's up for the group of 5 to decide the best way to play the Minigame. You can dig as soon as you begin the Minigame, and have a chance of digging up valuables or treasure. Or, you can walk further into the collapsing temple, and have a greater chance of digging up treasure, but not valuables. After a certain time, an earthquake will begin. The players then have a time, which counts down in the corner of their screen, to exit the temple. If they fail to do so after the time runs out, then they will die and lose whatever they were carrying.
Player Appearance: Player appearance is not set upon login. Everyone has a default look, and they all change dynamically according to their game-play choices. For example, a player with 99 Strength would have large arms. Each player will start out with randomly selected Hair, Beard, and Clothes. These can be changed at a Barbershop and Tailor.
Cooking: Players are able to cook Lobster at level 1, Swordfish at level 10, Monkfish at level 20, Cake at level 25, Potato at level 30, Cheese Potato at level 30, Cheese and Egg Potato at level 35, Egg at level 35, Basic Cocktails at level 40, Sharks at level 50, Manta ray at level 60, Golden Sharks at level 75, Advanced Cocktails at level 85, Sea Turtles at 90, Enchanted Meat at level 95, and Purple Sweets at level 99. The Chef Cooking Outfit can be unlocked via Cooking Minigames. This involves mixing and serving Drinks and Cocktails, and preparing food for others. Players are able to access the Cooking Guild at level 70. At level 99, the raw food cooked is given back cooked, but in noted form in the player's Inventory.
Food, and Eating: A lot of Servers try to make players Fish for their own Food and have a player-sustained economy for Fishing and Cooking. This works very seldom for them. It is boring and pointless on a R.S.P.S. because they have nothing to work for. Our Cooking and Fishing is designed to flood the markets, give the players a reason to get 99 Cooking/Fishing, give new players an easy way to make cash. When players eat 5 Food, they gain a buff to all statistics by +1.
Cooking Outfit: Master Chef Hat - +10% chance to successfully Cook Food. Master Chef Apron - +10% chance to successfully mix Cocktails. Master Chef Boots - Increases energy regain by 25% when the player's Inventory consists only of raw food.
Firemaking: Normal logs at level 1, Oak logs at level 10, Maple logs at level 25, Yew logs at level 40, Magic logs at level, 60, Colored Firelighters at level 70, Teak Logs at level 75, and Bronze Logs at level 85. At level 70 the player can wear pieces of the Firemaking outfit, each piece increases firemaking speed by 15%.
Magic: There are no longer three spell books. The new spell book will be a mix of all three spellbooks combined, but very different. This Spell tab contains Utility and Combat based spells. Here is a current list of spells: TZHAAR SPELL BOOK (Different randomly selected responses each time a Spell is clicked that cannot be cast because the player lacks the level: "You lack the knowledge to cast this Spell." "You do not have the level to cast this Spell." "You need a higher Magic level to cast this." "You lack the required level to use this Spell." "Your Magic level is not high enough to use this Spell." "You must have a higher Magic level to cast this Spell." "Your Magic level is too low to cast this Spell." "You do not meet the required Magic level to use this Spell." "Your Magic level is too low to use this Spell.") ----------Spells--------------- Fill Vials - Level 1 - Runes Req: 4 Water Runes; Fills all Empty Vials in the player's Inventory with water. (Utility) Fireball - level 1 - Runes Req: 2 Fire Runes; Does 0-5 damage on N.P.C. (Combat) Inferno - level 10 - Runes Req: 6 Fire Runes; Does 0-15 damage on N.P.C. (Combat) Telegrab - Level 10 - Runes Req: 2 Earth/Fire/Water Runes; Ability to grab items at a distance of 8 Tiles away (Utility) Vitality Curse - Level 20 - Runes Req: Earth/Fire/Water/Air Runes; Reduces N.P.C. Health by 10% for 10 seconds (Combat) Weakness Curse - Level 20 - Runes Req: TBA; Reduces all N.P.C. Defense statistics by 10% for 20 seconds (Combat) Strength Curse - Level 20 - Runes Req: TBA; Reduces N.P.C. Attack statsitics by 10% for 10 seconds (Combat) AquaBall - Level 30 - Runes Req: TBA; Does 0-25 damage on N.P.C. (Combat) AquaSphere - Level 30 - Runes Req: TBA; Does 0-30 damage on N.P.C. (Combat) Alchemy - Level 30 - Runes Req: 5 Nature Runes; Alchemizes the next item clicked to Gold (Utility) Cook Lobsters - Level 35 - Runes Req: TBA; Cooks all Lobsters in the player's Inventory, does not give Cooking Exp. (Utility) String Bows - Level 35 - Runes Req: TBA; Strings all unstring Bows in the player's Inventory, does not give Fletching Exp. (Utility) Materialize Vials - Level 35 - Runes Req: TBA; Fills the player's Inventory with 28 Vials, drops excess Vials to the ground (Utility) EarthShake - Level 40 - Runes Req: TBA; AoE Combat Attack Spell, does 0-30 damage on N.P.C. within 6 Tiles of the Player. Causes the Player's screen to shake for 4 seconds (Combat) FireComet - Level 40 - Runes Req: TBA; AoE Combat Attack Spell, does 0-30 damage on N.P.C. within 8 Tiles of the Player. Causes the N.P.C. to recieve a Burn de-buff (Combat) AquaTsunami - Level 40 - Runes Req: TBA; AoE Combat Attack Spell, does 0-20 damage on N.P.C. within 6 Tiles of the player. Causes a Stun de-buff to all N.P.C. for 2 seconds within range (Combat) Transmute Rune - Level 45 - Runes Req: TBA; Transmutes all Runite Ore in the player's Inventory into Runite Bars (Utility) Summon Hellcat - Level 45 - Runes Req: 50 Fire Runes; Summons a Hellcat to follow the player for 60 seconds. Whilst summoned, when a N.P.C. is struck in combat in any way by a player, the N.P.C. recieves a Burn de-buff (Utility) Summon Cat - Level 45 - Runes Req: 50 Air Runes; Summons a regular Cat to follow the player for 60 seconds. Has no affects whilst summoned and is purely cosmetic (Utility) Clean Herbs - Level 50 - Runes Req: 20 Earth Runes; Instantly Cleans all Dirty Herbs in the player's inventory, does not give Herblore Experience (Utility) Ore Oracle - Level 50 - Runes Req: TBA; Instantly able to prospect and identify Ore (Utility) Pack Rat - Level 50 - Runes Req: TBA; All items in your Inventory weigh half as much for 60 seconds (Utility) FireBlast - Level 60 - Runes Req: TBA; Does 0-35 damage on N.P.C. (Combat) Stat Spy - Level 60 - Runes Req: TBA; Allows you to see another player's statistics (Utility) Slayer Dart - Level 60 - Runes Req: TBA; A dart effective against Barrows minibosses and Slayer tasks, does 0-30 damage (Utility) Blood Blitz - Level 70 - Runes Req: TBA; An Ancient magick Spell that takes Health from one target and transfers it to the caster, does 0-30 damage (Combat) Ice Blitz - Level 70 - Runes Req: TBA; An Ancient magick Spell which freezes what it is cast upon in place for 8 seconds, does 0-25 damage. (Combat) Smoke Blitz - Level 70 - Runes Req: TBA; An Ancient magick Spell which applies the Poison effect to the target, does 0-30 damage (Combat) Loot Oracle - Level 75 - Runes Req: TBA; Allows you to predict what the next Loot drop from a N.P.C. will be (Utility) Create Portal - Level 75 - Runes Req: TBA; Creates a portal which can be used by the player to teleport them to a random pre-designated location (Utility) Summon Tzok Healer - Level 80 - Runes Req: TBA; Summons a Healer N.P.C. to follow you around. Automatically cleanses the player of de-buffs such as Poison, Burn, Drowning, ect. (Utility) Miracle Grow - Level 80 - Runes Req: TBA; Speeds the growth of all crops in the Farming skill by x2 (Utility) Black Hole - Level 85 - Runes Req: TBA; Allows the player to create a Black Hole, which does not need to be clicked upon to enter. Once the player moves into it, it automatically teleports the player to a random pre-designated location (Utility) Combat Oracle - Level 90 - Runes Req: TBA; When used in an Instanced Dungeon or Raid, can predict the chance of success given the group and several factors. Ice Barrage - Spell that can't be left out. EarthQuake - Level 95 - Runes Req: 500 Earth Runes; Does 5-45 damage and gives a 5 second Stun de-buff to all N.P.C. within a 14 Tile Radius (Combat) Hurricane - Level 96 - Runes Req: 500 Water/Earth/Air Runes; Does 5-50 damage, applies the drowning effect for 30 seconds, and gives a 10 second Stun de-buff to all N.P.C. within a 18 Tile Radius (Combat) SolarFlare - Level 99 - Runes Req: 750 Fire 750 Earth Runes; Does 10-50 damage, applies the burn effect for 30 seconds, and gives a 10 second Stun de-buff to all N.P.C. within a 18 Tile Radius (Combat)
Loot Tier: Any drop obtained by the player that qualifies as above an Uncommon drop is yelled globally to all players. - Mundane (feathers, vials, ect). - Common (rune scimitar, potions, ect). - Uncommon (abyssal whip, dragon scimitar, ect). - Quality (fury, dragon chain, zerk ring, ect). - Rare (dfs, dfh, ect). - Epic (bandos, armadyl, ect). - Legendary (godswords, ect). - Artifact (bronze, gilded, ect). - Holiday (partyhats, masks, ect). - Bind on Account (costumes, event rewards, ect).
Slayer: Money is mailed to the player once their Slayer task is completed, it takes into account how many enemies were slain, and the difficulty level of the Task you accepted. Epic tasks are Bosses only. Easy tasks - 1,000 Coins per enemy slain Medium tasks - 2,000 Coins per enemy slain Hard tasks - 3,000 Coins per enemy slain Epic tasks - 50,000 Coins per enemy slain The Black Mask will provide a +10% bonus to Strength and Attack when worn and attacking your assigned Slayer Task. The Hexcrest and Focus Sight are also useable during your assigned Slayer Task. The Hexcrest provides a +10% Magic Accuracy boost, while the Focus Sight provides a +15% bonus to Ranged Accuracy. All of these Items are purchasable via the Slayer Point Exchange, which can be accessed via the Slayer Master. This Exchange is much like the others, and Players can also spend their Slayer Points on other Items and useful Trinkets and features. Even Cosmetics such as a Pet.
Bronze Platebody: - Allows the wearer to recieve Slayer experience from Slayer monsters without requiring a task. Also doubles the Coin reward mailed to the player for Slayer tasks. - Functions as a teleport-other to all in-game Instances. - Once per hour the player may use the Platebody to negate N.P.C. melee attacks for 10 seconds. Bronze Full Helmet: - Functions as a key to all in-game Instances. - When worn it warns the player of upcoming special attacks from both N.P.C. and Players. - Can predict the flow of all combat and future combat events.
Dropping Bronze Artifacts: When anything Bronze is dropped on the ground, it immediately turns into dust. This dust is often used as a material in high-level crafting for things such as a Fire Bomb. When Bronze Arrows/Bolts are dropped, at least 50 must be dropped at one time in order for them to turn into Bronze Dust.
Questing: Quests will be divided into four categories: Regular, Epic, Instance, and Raid. Raid Quests will be repeatable and refresh every day, but all other Quests are completed for good once finished. Regular Quests will be able to be completed by everyone at every level regardless. These Quests consist mainly of 'Errand' Quests, 'Retrieve' Quests, 'Talk-to' Quests, etc. Epic Quests will be for people who are dedicated to the extreme challenge for the extra edge over the competition, these will be very hard and long Quests which require a lot of patience and persistence on the Player's part. The Rewards are great and many, and they're the same for everyone. Daily Quests award different Rewards each time they Refresh, but always at least give Coins as a Reward for completing a Daily Quest. There will also be some Quests which require mutliple Players to work together to complete. There ARE NO AND WILL NEVER BE ANY Quest Guides released. Any sort of Quest Guide or F.A.Q. is forbidden and will be deleted. Instance Quests are recieved from Quest-givers found outside, inside and around Instances. These Quests are such as Kill Quests for mini-bosses and bosses, retrieval Quests, and more.
Server Firsts: Not only will there be Easy/Medium/Hard scaled Achievement Diary content, but we are proud to announce Server First Achievements. These Achievements will be only able to be unlocked by players who accomplish them first. For example, the Achievement to be the first player to obtain 99 Fletching. All players can view this task, but only one can complete it. Once the task is completed, it is also completed for all other players. All players can then click on that Achievement to view who the first person to reach that goal was. Examples of Server First Achievements: 200,000,000 experience in Cooking, First Person to Defeat Jad, First Person to obtain a partyhat, ect. Players who complete a Server First Achievement will be rewarded in three ways. 1. A Scroll (item) delivered to the player's Mailbox that certifies them as having completed a Server First Achievement. 2. The permanent reminder to everyone that YOU were one of the first people to complete a major Achievement. 3. The ability to click on the Achievement they've completed to let everyone around them know what they've done
P.S. No, this does not mean that these aren't being Developed for Cynosure. If you were told these ideas by a Staffer or Team Member, it just means that you were trusted to hear these first.

item.title: [Public Information] Official Concepts Thread [Truly Unique]
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Teem_Rocket, post:26, topic:469297”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=586427.msg4284420#msg4284420 date=1366148593]
So, you’ve applied a specific ID to one clients.
[/quote]

I’m sorry about calling you “a silly goose”. Lol.

You shouldn’t do this by the way, if that’s what you’re after, because It’s a terribad way of going about it.[/quote]
I don’t want to do it - I know the way to do it and I do it the way for RSPS the same way that I do it at work, and that’s across more than one language However, you clearly stated that sending server-wide messages would be better if they used “specific client selection” rather than loops, yet you haven’t shown an example of how to use “specific client selection” to send the exact same message to all players at the same time, you have instead given vague answers to questions I haven’t asked.

Also, you said “1. Add a specific I.D. to one client.”, so please don’t correct it to “clients”.

Read full topic

item.title: [Public Information] Official Concepts Thread [Truly Unique]
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:28, topic:469297”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=586427.msg4284428#msg4284428 date=1366149527]
T_R has already shown you what you need to do, you’re either

  1. too ignorant to understand
    or
  2. too proud to accept defeat

You can try all you want to continue this debate but I guarantee you, you will not win silly goose.
[/quote]
ox random xi, you shouldn’t get involved in their little debate. Also, i would suggest that if Ambokile had any further problems he should message Team_Rocket rather then continuing the spam train.

These concepts are the same as you’ve posted on your current account? O.o[/quote]

What do you mean as my current account? These are the ones I shared with select people on Skype to get input, yes.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Ambokile:

So, you’ve applied a specific ID to one clients.

I’m sorry about calling you “a silly goose”. Lol.

You shouldn’t do this by the way, if that’s what you’re after, because It’s a terribad way of going about it.

item.title: [Public Information] Official Concepts Thread [Truly Unique]
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Teem_Rocket, post:24, topic:469297”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=586427.msg4284364#msg4284364 date=1366143253]

[quote author=Teem_Rocket link=topic=586427.msg4284345#msg4284345 date=1366140108][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=586427.msg4284333#msg4284333 date=1366138461]
And how would you “pluck” a client from a group of clients without looping through the group?
[/quote]

selectively plucked based on certain factors.

It’s very possible, despite what your ‘ringleader’ may tell you.
[/quote]

My “ringleader”? I was hoping that you’d have become less stupid in your time away but it appears you haven’t. I’m not part of some syndicate against you, I was intrigued about your answer to this:

[quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=583626.msg4201383#msg4201383 date=1358251013]

use

for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) if(p != null) Client c2 = p;
[/quote][/quote]

That doesn’t have any effect on performance.

Just one is “prettier”, but I would go with it, just saying, it’s more of a preference.

Why would you want to Loop though? There’s no need.

How else do you expect to send the message to everyone online…

There are multiple ways of doing this. Specific Client selection is a good example. This might come as a shock to you, but there’s a different world of Java outside of RuneScape Private Servers.

So go on, show me how to send a message to every player online using “specific client selection” without a loop. So please, go ahead and show me! Also, interesting how that link only shows posts about/regarding you.

That’s because of how you searched, you use Google as well…? Yet I’m the stupid one… right.

Try this out:

  1. Add a specific I.D. to one client.
  2. Identify the I.D. as ‘flagged’ server-sided for the message via conditions. (If you know what this means)
  3. Fetch/check during Server-Client communications.
  4. ???
  5. PROFIT!!!

That isn’t even a halfway decent method of doing this.

P.S. This was about 3-4 months ago. You say you aren’t butthurt, yet you resort to name calling and bringing up the past. Now that I’ve given you a generalization about how this can be done, you’re a moron if you don’t understand what I’m saying. Kthx. We’re probably both going to be warned for spamming as well.

P.P.S. If your next post is going to be about how that’s still a loop, you’re a silly goose, because it IS NOT.[/quote]

“you resort to name calling”
“you’re a moron”
“you’re a silly goose”

So, you’ve applied a specific ID to one client. Yet, you said that you can send a message to all players online using specific client selection. I would like to know how to can send a message to all players online, using the ID you explained in the previous post, without using a loop. There’s no need to be angry, I’m asking questions and not attacking you so I’d like you to treat me with the same amount of respect (you moron, you goose, you silly goose, you silly moron, you moronic goose, etc)

Read full topic

item.title: [Public Information] Official Concepts Thread [Truly Unique]
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:23, topic:469297”][quote author=Teem_Rocket link=topic=586427.msg4284345#msg4284345 date=1366140108][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=586427.msg4284333#msg4284333 date=1366138461]
And how would you “pluck” a client from a group of clients without looping through the group?
[/quote]

selectively plucked based on certain factors.

It’s very possible, despite what your ‘ringleader’ may tell you.
[/quote]

My “ringleader”? I was hoping that you’d have become less stupid in your time away but it appears you haven’t. I’m not part of some syndicate against you, I was intrigued about your answer to this:

[quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=583626.msg4201383#msg4201383 date=1358251013]

[quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=583626.msg4201378#msg4201378 date=1358250114]

use

for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) if(p != null) Client c2 = p;
[/quote][/quote]

That doesn’t have any effect on performance.

Just one is “prettier”, but I would go with it, just saying, it’s more of a preference.

Why would you want to Loop though? There’s no need.

How else do you expect to send the message to everyone online…

There are multiple ways of doing this. Specific Client selection is a good example. This might come as a shock to you, but there’s a different world of Java outside of RuneScape Private Servers.

So go on, show me how to send a message to every player online using “specific client selection” without a loop. So please, go ahead and show me! Also, interesting how that link only shows posts about/regarding you.[/quote]

That’s because of how you searched, you use Google as well…? Yet I’m the stupid one… right.

Try this out:

  1. Add a specific I.D. to one client.
  2. Identify the I.D. as ‘flagged’ server-sided for the message via conditions. (If you know what this means)
  3. Fetch/check during Server-Client communications.
  4. ???
  5. PROFIT!!!

That isn’t even a halfway decent method of doing this.

P.S. This was about 3-4 months ago. You say you aren’t butthurt, yet you resort to name calling and bringing up the past. Now that I’ve given you a generalization about how this can be done, you’re a moron if you don’t understand what I’m saying. Kthx. We’re probably both going to be warned for spamming as well.

P.P.S. If your next post is going to be about how that’s still a loop, you’re a silly goose, because it IS NOT.

Read full topic

item.title: [Public Information] Official Concepts Thread [Truly Unique]
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Teem_Rocket, post:22, topic:469297”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=586427.msg4284333#msg4284333 date=1366138461]
And how would you “pluck” a client from a group of clients without looping through the group?
[/quote]

selectively plucked based on certain factors.

It’s very possible, despite what your ‘ringleader’ may tell you.[/quote]

My “ringleader”? I was hoping that you’d have become less stupid in your time away but it appears you haven’t. I’m not part of some syndicate against you, I was intrigued about your answer to this:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:16, topic:466692”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=583626.msg4201378#msg4201378 date=1358250114]

[quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=583626.msg4201359#msg4201359 date=1358247391]

use

for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) if(p != null) Client c2 = p;
[/quote][/quote]

That doesn’t have any effect on performance.

Just one is “prettier”, but I would go with it, just saying, it’s more of a preference.

Why would you want to Loop though? There’s no need.

How else do you expect to send the message to everyone online…

There are multiple ways of doing this. Specific Client selection is a good example. This might come as a shock to you, but there’s a different world of Java outside of RuneScape Private Servers.[/quote]

So go on, show me how to send a message to every player online using “specific client selection” without a loop. So please, go ahead and show me! Also, interesting how that link only shows posts about/regarding you.

Read full topic

item.title: [Public Information] Official Concepts Thread [Truly Unique]

item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Ambokile:

Which word is that?

Someone edited the word “penises” into the post.

Ambokile:

And how would you “pluck” a client from a group of clients without looping through the group?

Teem_Rocket:

selectively plucked based on certain factors.

It’s very possible, despite what your ‘ringleader’ may tell you.
